Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Charade \Cha*rade"\, n. [F. charade, cf. Pr. charrada long chat, It ciarlare to chat, whence E. charlatan.] A verbal or acted enigma based upon a word which has two or more significant syllables or parts, each of which, as well as the word itself, is to be guessed from the descriptions or representations. [1913 Webster]

charade n 1: a composition that imitates somebody's style in a humorous way [syn: {parody}, {lampoon}, {spoof}, {sendup}, {mockery}, {takeoff}, {burlesque}, {travesty}, {pasquinade}, {put-on}] 2: a word acted out in an episode of the game of charades
